abstract: Brigham Young University says it will spare students who report sexual assaults from facing punishment for violations of its honor code, such as drinking or extramarital sex, that may have happened near or at time of assault; university has been criticized for investigating such violations by assault victims in past.

headline.print_headline: New Sexual Assault Policy at Brigham Young
headline.main: Brigham Young Students Who Report Sexual Assault Won’t Face Honor Code Sanctions

snippet: The university said that offering amnesty from potential punishment would help encourage students to report sex-related crimes....
lead_paragraph: The university said that offering amnesty from potential punishment would help encourage students to report sex-related crimes.
